ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 cup shredded cooked chicken
  • 1 cup black beans, rinsed and drained
  • 1 cup corn kernels, fresh or frozen

  • 1/2 cup diced red bell pepper
  • 1/4 cup chopped green onions
  • 1 teaspoon ground cumin
  • 1 teaspoon chili powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 8 eggroll wrappers

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a large bowl, combine the shredded chicken, black beans, corn, cheese, red bell pepper, and green onions. Mix well.

  3. Place an eggroll wrapper on a clean surface, spoon about 2 tablespoons of the filling onto the center, and roll tightly, sealing the edges with a little water.
  4. Heat oil in a deep skillet over medium heat. Once hot, carefully add the eggrolls, frying until golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes per side.
  5. Remove the eggrolls and drain on paper towels to absorb excess oil.
  6. Serve warm with your favorite dipping sauce.

  • 8 ounces dark chocolate, chopped

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Begin by melting the dark chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl. Heat in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until smooth and fully melted.

  3. In a separate bowl, melt the white chocolate using the same method. Once melted, stir in the peppermint extract for added flavor.
  4. Drizzle the white chocolate over the dark chocolate layer, creating a marbled effect. Use a toothpick to swirl them together gently.
  5. Sprinkle the crushed peppermint candies and a pinch of sea salt over the top. Allow the bark to set at room temperature for about 30 minutes or until firm.
  6. Once set, break the bark into pieces and enjoy or package it as a festive gift.

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 pre-made pie crust, thawed
  • 1 cup pecan halves, toasted
  • 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips
  • 3 large eggs, beaten
  • 1 cup corn syrup
  • 1 cup brown sugar, packed
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Place the pie crust in a pie dish and set aside.
  2. In a saucepan over low heat, melt the chocolate chips until smooth, stirring frequently to prevent burning.
  3. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, corn syrup, brown sugar, vanilla extract, and salt until well combined.
  4. Gradually stir the melted chocolate into the egg mixture until fully incorporated.
  5. Fold in the toasted pecans, then pour the filling into the prepared pie crust.
  6. Bake for 40-45 minutes, or until the filling is set and slightly puffed. Allow to cool before serving.

  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 2 cups fresh strawberries, sliced

  1. Preheat the oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.

  6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture, alternating with the milk, starting and ending with the flour mixture.
  7. Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans.
  8. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
  9. Let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then turn out onto wire racks to cool completely.
  10. Whip the heavy cream with the powdered sugar until soft peaks form.
  11. Once the cakes are cooled, place one layer on a serving plate and spread a layer of whipped cream over it.
  12. Top with sliced strawberries, then place the second cake layer on top.
  13. Frost the top and sides of the cake with the remaining whipped cream and decorate with additional strawberries.
